Indonesian lion dance is widely considered a
traditional folk art form
favored by Asian people
every Tet holiday in Hong Kong. China
also has an extremely unique fire dragon dance.
This ritual appears in special places.  The area dates back to the
19th century and has been preserved and preserved by many generations
to
this day. It originated from a legend in
1880 after a plague attacked a
village in Hong Kong. People created a
model of a fire dragon and then mocked it.  for three nights
during the Mid-Autumn Festival to ward off
epidemics. According to legend, people
made fire dragons from straw and
scented wrinkles to chase away diseases. That was when the
tradition of fire dragon dancing began to
form.  67 m long stuffed with straw
made from many branches of rattan, bamboo, hemp,
jade grass and straw. About 12,000
incense sticks are burned before performing,
and this giant fruit requires about a hectare to
300 people to move around the stages.  Streets
